Choices: Marshallese: Alternate Surveillance for COVID-19 in a Unique Population

The MASC-UP study proposes the use of a multimodal, community-driven surveillance platform to generate effective mitigation strategies for reducing the spread of SARS-Cov-2 in a high-risk, clustered population. We also emphasize surveillance for early identification of pre-symptomatic and asymptomatic cases in a context that acknowledges complexities arising from overlapping political, economic, cultural, and social factors.
